title: Why There Is No Gender Wage Gap
summary: The Equal Pay Act of 1963 prohibits employers from discriminating against employees with regard to the amount of compensation they receive based on their gender. Despite good intentions, the law hasnâ€™t actually done much to correct the issue of unequal compensation for equal work. Despite the fact that more women are entering traditionally male-dominated industries, the wage gap between men and women is actually shrinking. Women are more likely to work in lower-paying industries, like the education and health care fields, and women tend to be less willing to negotiate for higher pay.

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"What Is The Gender Wage Gap?"),mdx("p",null,`The gender wage gap is a measure of the average difference between the wages earned by men and women over the course of a year, calculated based on hourly or yearly earnings (whichever is greater).
The key word in the above definition, however, is average. What we\u2019re talking about when we say there is a gender wage gap is not that women are paid less than men for the same jobs. Rather, it\u2019s that men and women tend to work in different occupations and industries, and that women are more likely to work part-time, which explains the bulk of the gender wage gap.`),mdx("h2",null,"Why Doesn\u2019t Equal Pay For Equal Work Already Exist?"),mdx("p",null,`The Equal Pay Act of 1963 was meant to put an end to all of this. The principle behind the law was simple: If two people perform equal work in the same workplace for the same employer, then they should earn equal pay, regardless of their gender.
The problem is that, despite good intentions from the lawmakers who created the law and the fact that it is still on the books, the Equal Pay Act hasn\u2019t actually done much to correct the issue of unequal compensation for equal work.
Why is that? Well, the problem is that for the most part, this law is unenforceable.
To understand why this is, we need to take a look at the law\u2019s language.`),mdx("h2",null,"Why There Is No Wage Gap Due To Gender Bias"),mdx("p",null,`The Equal Pay Act of 1963 prohibits employers from discriminating against employees with regard to the amount of compensation they receive based on their gender. In other words, if a man and a woman work in the same position, they should receive the same pay.
What\u2019s key here is the phrase \u201Cbased on their gender.\u201D The point of the Equal Pay Act is not to ensure that men and women in the same company are compensated equally for the same job with the same skill level and effort required.`),mdx("h2",null,"Why There Is No Wage Gap Due To Women\u2019s Career Choices"),mdx("p",null,`There may be some differences in pay between men and women, but there are also plenty of factors that have nothing to do with gender bias. For example, women are more likely to work part-time, which tends to lead to lower overall earnings, compared to men who are more likely to work full-time. Women are also more likely to work in lower-paying industries, like the education and health care fields.
Additionally, some studies have shown that women tend to be less willing to negotiate for higher pay, which could affect the amount of money they earn over the course of their careers.
These are just a few examples of how men and women\u2019s career choices lead to different levels of compensation, and none of them have anything to do with gender discrimination.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"The reality is that, despite the fact that more women are entering traditionally male-dominated industries, the wage gap between men and women is actually shrinking, not growing."),mdx("p",null,"This shrinking of the wage gap can be attributed to a number of factors, including an increase in women\u2019s educational attainment, more women entering traditionally male-dominated occupations, and an increase in women\u2019s participation in the workforce."),mdx("p",null,"With more women in the workforce, the average salary for all workers is likely to increase, and the wage gap will continue to decrease as a result."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Best Cat Breeds in the World

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Cats are mysterious creatures, it\u2019s almost impossible to know what they\u2019re thinking. But that hasn\u2019t stopped cat lovers from all over the world falling head over heels in love with these cuddly felines. Whether you like them for their beauty, intelligence or simply for their cuteness, there is no denying that cats make wonderful pets.
There are a wide range of different breeds of cat but generally speaking there are two main categories; longhaired and shorthaired cats. Within these two groups there are numerous sub-groups and hybrids with specific traits from different types of cat \u2013 check out this article to learn more about the basic types of cat!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 50 Ways to Keep the Spark Alive in Your Relationship
How to Deal with Trust Issues in Relationships

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you first start dating someone, trust probably isn\u2019t the biggest issue on your mind. You\u2019re getting to know this person and trying to figure out if there might be a potential future with them or not. However, once you get into a relationship with this person and things get more serious, trust can very quickly become an issue.
Even if you don\u2019t trust someone right away, that doesn\u2019t mean the trust issues don\u2019t come up later on. It may take time for them to make you feel uneasy or distrustful of your partner. But it also could be something that crops up almost immediately \u2013 especially if you meet them in a place like a nightclub, bar or other place where people tend to hookup without much thought as to who they\u2019re hooking up with! This article will offer some tips on how to deal with these trust issues in relationships and help resolve any problems from arising in the first place.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When it comes to internet famous animals, cats by far come out on top. With the rise of social media, cat videos and memes have taken over the internet. There are so many funny cats online that it\u2019s almost ridiculous. These kitty clips have gained a massive following online and catapulted these lovable felines into superstardom.
Cats are a part of Internet Culture in ways that other animals just aren\u2019t. They also have unique features that make them much easier to anthropomorphize and create humorous images with. This has led to an explosion in popularity among cats of all kinds, but especially hilarious ones like Grumpy Cat, Henrietta, and Lil Bub. Now let\u2019s take a look at the Top 10 Famous Cats In The World:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Resolve Conflicts through Mediation

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a process in which an impartial third party helps two people resolve their differences and reach an equitable solution to their conflict. The mediator doesn\u2019t take sides, but instead helps both parties understand each other\u2019s point of view. This way, the disputants can agree on a fair outcome and put an end to their disagreements.
If you are part of an organization that is going through a lot of conflict right now (or any time soon), mediation might be a good solution for reducing tensions, smoothing things over and getting everyone back on track. Here we\u2019ll explain what mediation is, why it works so well for resolving conflicts and how you can initiate it in your organization.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Drop It
How to Train Your Dog Not to Chew on Household Items

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you ready to give up chewing on household objects? How about your dog? Dogs love to chew. It\u2019s something that comes naturally for them, and there are many things you can buy or make that will help satisfy their natural instincts to chew. But as much as dogs love to have objects that they can gnaw on, it\u2019s not always safe \u2013 or advisable \u2013 to let them do it in the home. There are plenty of household items that dogs shouldn\u2019t be allowed to chew, because it could lead to potential hazards or unsanitary conditions.
Even if your dog has never chewed on inappropriate things before, a new puppy will almost certainly try out things beyond what is safe for him. How you train him from the very beginning will determine how much damage he can do if he goes after something he shouldn\u2019t. So read on and learn how to stop your dog from chewing on anything other than his own toys.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Tips for Sticking to Your New Year's Resolutions

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"New Year\u2019s resolutions are like a clean slate for the coming year. What you do with that opportunity is up to you. Maybe you resolve to eat healthier, exercise more or reduce stress and anxiety. Maybe you decide to learn a new skill, read more books, help others or travel more. Or maybe your resolution is to do something completely different \u2014 like learn a language, stop procrastinating or read the complete works of Shakespeare. The possibilities are endless, but sticking to those resolutions can be challenging. The key is establishing habits that will last all 365 days of the year and not just one crazy day in January. It takes small but deliberate changes in everyday life that add up over time and become second nature. Here are 10 easy tips for sticking to your New Year\u2019s resolutions:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
